item.title: Today’s Contexto #1243: Hints & Answer For February 12, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Contexto is a word association game that gives you a new word to guess every single day. With every attempt, the AI algorithm determines how close your guess is to the daily answer based on thematic and contextual similarity.

Sometimes, though, no matter how experienced you are, the word you’re looking for can be incredibly vague and hard to deduce. Luckily for you, this guide is full of hints to give you a helping hand, but make sure you give today’s Contexto a go if you haven’t already!

How To Play Contexto

Contexto is incredibly simple to play, but difficult to master. All you have to do is type words into the search bar, and the AI algorithm will tell you how close your word is to the answer.

You’ll know how close your guess is based on the colour of the bar and the number next to it.

  • Red includes guesses with the number 1,501 and above, meaning you’re way off from the secret word.
  • Orange includes guesses between 301 and 1,500, meaning you’re getting closer, but still some ways off.
  • Green includes guesses between 1 and 300, meaning you’re on the right track.

Best Contexto Tips & Tricks

  • Start off using broad terms, then narrow down once you’ve got under the 1,000 mark.
  • Try using Nouns first, and dip into verbs or adjectives once you’ve discovered the context.
  • Experiment with random words at times, especially as different forms of a root word can rank differently, such as work and worker.
  • Guess away, as unlike other word games like Wordle, you aren’t limited to a strict number of attempts.

Best Starting Words For Contexto

Here are some great starting words to get you going with Contexto:

  • Thing
  • Person
  • Place
  • Animal
  • Work
  • Nature
  • Game
  • Concept
  • Idea
  • Food

Contexto Hints For Today, February 12, 2026

Without giving away today’s Contexto answer, here are a few helpful hints to get you thinking in the right direction:

  • Hint 1: Think of something native to Australia
  • Hint 2: Flightless Birds
  • Hint 3: Similar to an Ostrich

If they don’t help, then here are the nine closest words, going from tenth to second:

  • Rooster
  • Dingo
  • Possum
  • Cassowary
  • Koala
  • Wallaby
  • Rheas
  • Kangaroo
  • Ostrich

Today’s Contexto Answer For Game #1243 On February 12, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, and still can’t figure out today’s Contexto answer, then you can find it down below:

Answer: Emu

An emu is a large, flightless bird that’s endemic to Australia. They have long necks and legs and closely resemble an ostrich.

When Is The Next Contexto Game After #1243?

Contexto is updated daily at 12 AM or Midnight in your respective time zone, meaning the next game will start on February 13.

The Contexto schedule is very consistent, with a new game releasing at the same time every day.

How did you find today’s Contexto? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more daily guides, check out IG’s other word game guides:

  • Quordle
  • NYT Connections

item.title: Today’s Quordle #1480: All Answers & Hints For February 12, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Quordle takes the complexity of the original daily word game and ups the ante by having you solve four solutions at once. Your 100% attention suddenly needs to be diverted four ways, and completing the daily Quordle is a tough proposition, no matter how experienced you are. The February 12, 2026, Quordle has four new words for you to find, and this guide has hints and a helping hand to have you be four for four.

Before the information comes thick and fast at you, make sure you give today’s Quordle a go if you haven’t already!

How To Play Quordle Daily Word Game

Quordle is different from other daily word games as it requires you to correctly work out four words at once, and you can attempt this through the official Quordle website.

Before anything else, check out this set of instructions on finding and playing Quordle:

  1. Go to the Quordle website.
  2. You should be presented with four equal boxes reminiscent of a Wordle setup.
  3. Enter your first guess using the keyboard input at the bottom of the screen.
  4. The game will fill out the first of nine lines for all four boxes.
  5. A green box means the letter is correct AND goes in that exact spot on the grid.
  6. A yellow box means the letter is correct BUT needs to go in a different spot on the grid.
  7. A grey box means the letter DOESN’T feature at all.
  8. Do this up to nine times to try to solve all four words.

Best Quordle Tips & Tricks

  • Try to use as many of the five vowels as you can in your first two guesses.
  • Focus on solving words with more green and yellow boxes first.
  • Avoid reusing letters that are not applicable across any of the four answers.
  • Don’t be afraid to try the same letter twice in one word, as answers can be sneaky like that.
  • Play the Practice game first if you’re not used to Quordle, or need a warm-up before today’s new game!

Quordle Hints For Today, February 12, 2026

Top-left grid

  • Hint 1: A growth.
  • Hint 2: Can be rearranged to make a female name.

Top-right grid

  • Hint 1: You’re reading one right now!
  • Hint 2: Can escort people who are lost.

Bottom-left grid

  • Hint 1: Add too much of it to your tea, and it’s called this.
  • Hint 2: A type of white color.

Bottom-right grid

  • Hint 1: Works underground in caves.
  • Hint 2: A very young human, but spelled differently.

Starter Words For February 12, 2026 Quordle

You should consider using one or more of the following words to get you started with today’s new Quordle puzzle:

  • Piled
  • Grope
  • Merry

SPOILER WARNING: The answers will be revealed next!

All Today’s Quordle Answers For February 12, 2026

Get ready for all four of today’s Quordle answers, going from the top-left grid to the top-right grid, then the bottom-left, and finally the bottom-right.

When Is The Next Quordle Daily Game?

Quordle is updated daily at 12 AM or Midnight in your respective time zone and region, meaning the next game will start on February 13.

The Quordle schedule is very consistent and always comes out at the same time each new day.

What Is Quordle?

Quordle is a variation of the popular Wordle daily word game, but instead of giving you one word to solve, you must figure out four unique words at the same time.

Needless to say, Quordle is MUCH harder than Wordle! There are days when it might be an achievement just to solve one of the four words. Whereas you can guess Wordle with your first answer, that’s impossible with Quordle. You need to be thinking on all cylinders with Quordle, and Insider Gaming strongly recommends you take the hints above on board and apply them to future Quordle puzzles.

Additionally, a new daily guide will be on the website for every new puzzle. Keep coming back each day for hints and solutions to the newest Quordle daily word games!

How did you find today’s Quordle? If you have any feedback on what you want to see added to these guides, share your thoughts via the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

You should also check out IG’s other word game guides:

  • NYT Connections Hints Today (#977)—Answers for Thursday, February 12
  • Today’s Strands #710 Hints and Answers for February 11, 2026

item.title: Kojima and Zampella Almost Created a First-Person Metal Gear Solid Game
item.content:encoded:
Hideo Kojima recently took to the stage at DICE in Las Vegas to reveal something long-forgotten. Shortly after the release of Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots in 2008, he ‘had many discussions’ with the late Vince Zampella about creating a first-person MGS game.

The title, which has understandably never seen the light of day, would have represented a major pivot for the Metal Gear franchise. While it has featured snippets of a first-person perspective in some sequences, we’ve never had a dedicated first-person title in the series.

Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots launched to a positive reception way back in 2008, emerging as a core PlayStation 3 title with immense cinematic potential. It represented a penultimate point for Kojima, as the next title, Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain, would be his final major release in the series before leaving Konami.

In 2008, Vince Zampella was busying himself with the development of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, the sequel to 2007’s Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare. This would have been when he was the CEO at Infinity Ward, and up to a year and a half before he was unexpectedly let go from the company.

In April 2010, Zampella founded Respawn Entertainment and went to work developing Titanfall.

But in a new segment at DICE, Hideo Kojima spoke fondly of the late Zampella, who died just before Christmas in a car wreck in California. In a post on social media from Geoff Keighley, it was confirmed that Kojima and Zampella had ‘many discussions’ about creating a first-person Metal Gear Solid game, building on the success of MGS4.

Nothing more was said on the matter, but it’s safe to assume that a first-person Metal Gear Solid game would have drastically shifted the game’s perspective in more ways than one. In the comments under Keighley’s post, die-hard MGS fans stressed that the franchise ‘only works’ as a third-person shooter.

Kojima also confirmed that Zampella helped him to establish Kojima Productions after parting ways with Konami around 2015.

Do you think a first-person Metal Gear Solid game would have worked? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Highguard’s developer has undergone mass layoffs

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#977)—Answers for Thursday, February 122
item.content:encoded:
You’ve almost made it to the end of the week, but let us know in the comments how your NYT Connections streak is keeping up. Are you in double digits? Triple? Regardless of where you’re at, I’ve got the NYT Connections hints and solutions you need below to keep pushing that count up!

Read on to get today’s NYT Connections answers as quickly as possible.

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 12)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • MAY
  • YANK
  • A
  • CARD
  • FROZEN
  • PRODUCE
  • DANCING
  • DAIRY
  • MAKE
  • JAY
  • FAST
  • FORM
  • DRAG
  • FIRM
  • MOLD
  • TIGHT

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Ways to build things
  • Green – Stuck in place
  • Blue – Abbreviate MLB teams and players
  • Purple – Words that could go before ‘queen’

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 12:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 12 (#977)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – FORM, MAKE, MOLD, PRODUCE
  • Green – FAST, FIRM, FROZEN, TIGHT
  • Blue – A, CARD, JAY, YANK
  • Purple – DAIRY, DANCING, DRAG, MAY

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Senior Editor and Esports Lead
